headline: RTX, Northrop Grumman, Halliburton, BP: Trending Tickers
summary: Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Alexandra Canal take a closer look at some of today's trending tickers. Defense companies are in focus after RTX (RTX) warned of a $850 million hit from tariffs and Northrop Grumman (NOC) cut its outlook. Halliburton (HAL) stock falls after the company highlighted the negative impacts of tariffs as it reported declining revenue and earnings. Elliott Management increased its stake in BP (BP), making the activist investor firm the second-largest shareholder of the stock. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Northrop Grumman (NOC) Shares Are Getting Obliterated Today
summary: Shares of security and aerospace company Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) fell 14.6% in the afternoon session after the company reported weak results for the first quarter of 2025: sales came in lower than expected, and profits fell well short of what Wall Street was hoping for.

raw.headline: Why Northrop Grumman (NOC) Shares Are Getting Obliterated Today
raw.summary: Shares of security and aerospace company Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) fell 14.6% in the afternoon session after the company reported weak results for the first quarter of 2025: sales came in lower than expected, and profits fell well short of what Wall Street was hoping for.

headline: Northrop Grumman Trims 2025 Outlook Following Slower Sales, Higher Bomber-Program Costs
summary: Northrop Grumman  first-quarter earnings and sales missed analysts’ estimates as delayed awards and higher-than-expected costs weighed on results, prompting it to cut its outlook for the year.  The defense contractor said it experienced a slower ramp up in sales for the quarter due to the delay and booked an additional $477 million pretax loss on its B-21 bomber program, citing higher costs from manufacturing changes.  “Most of the change that we have experienced and that have resulted in now the close to $2 billion of charges on the program are due to inflationary factors,” Chief Executive  Kathy Warden  said on an earnings call.

raw.headline: Northrop Grumman Trims 2025 Outlook Following Slower Sales, Higher Bomber-Program Costs
raw.summary: Northrop Grumman  first-quarter earnings and sales missed analysts’ estimates as delayed awards and higher-than-expected costs weighed on results, prompting it to cut its outlook for the year.  The defense contractor said it experienced a slower ramp up in sales for the quarter due to the delay and booked an additional $477 million pretax loss on its B-21 bomber program, citing higher costs from manufacturing changes.  “Most of the change that we have experienced and that have resulted in now the close to $2 billion of charges on the program are due to inflationary factors,” Chief Executive  Kathy Warden  said on an earnings call.

headline: Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) Reports Decline In Q1 Revenue And Earnings

This stock performance appears counterintuitive given these financial metrics but can be understood in the context of broader market dynamics. While the Dow Jones surged significantly, gaining over 1,000 points as markets bounced...

headline: Defense stocks sink as RTX warns of $850 million hit from tariffs
summary: Shares of major U.S. defense contractors tanked Tuesday, with Northrop Grumman (NOC) and RTX (RTX) ranking among the S&P 500’s steepest decliners after earnings reports flagged cost overruns, shrinking margins, and rising tariff exposure — even as revenue remained strong.

raw.headline: Defense stocks sink as RTX warns of $850 million hit from tariffs
raw.summary: Shares of major U.S. defense contractors tanked Tuesday, with Northrop Grumman (NOC) and RTX (RTX) ranking among the S&P 500’s steepest decliners after earnings reports flagged cost overruns, shrinking margins, and rising tariff exposure — even as revenue remained strong.

headline: US defense contractors mostly maintain forecasts despite Trump tariffs
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Major U.S. defense contractors are mostly maintaining their financial forecasts for 2025, saying it is too soon to understand the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.  Lockheed Martin, the largest defense firm, reaffirmed its forecasts for the year on Tuesday, buoyed by resilient demand for its missile systems and fighter jets.  Similarly, Northrop Grumman said its profit margins may narrow, but stuck with its sales prediction, indicating some confidence in the face of trade tensions.

raw.headline: US defense contractors mostly maintain forecasts despite Trump tariffs
raw.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Major U.S. defense contractors are mostly maintaining their financial forecasts for 2025, saying it is too soon to understand the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.  Lockheed Martin, the largest defense firm, reaffirmed its forecasts for the year on Tuesday, buoyed by resilient demand for its missile systems and fighter jets.  Similarly, Northrop Grumman said its profit margins may narrow, but stuck with its sales prediction, indicating some confidence in the face of trade tensions.

headline: Why Northrop Grumman Stock Is Plummeting Today
summary: The stock of Northrop Grumman (NYSE: NOC) is getting hit with big sell-offs Tuesday following the company's recently published first-quarter results.  In addition to weaker-than-anticipated performance last quarter, the company also lowered its full-year performance targets.  Revenue fell 7% year over year due to softer performance for its space systems and aeronautics systems.

Revenue fell 7% year over year due to softer performance for its space systems and aeronautics systems.

headline: RTX's $850M tariff hit, 3M stock gains, 3,521% solar tariff
summary: Brad Smith examines some of the trading day's trending stories as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Defense stocks are under pressure after RTX (RTX) warns of an $850 million hit from tariffs despite cost-cutting efforts and some tariff exemptions. Shares of 3M (MMM) pop, lifting the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) higher, after the company maintained its full-year outlook despite trade war risks. Solar stocks like First Solar (FSLR), Sunrun (RUN), and SolarEdge (SEDG) are trading higher after the US imposed a large tariff on solar imports from several Southeast Asian countries. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: CoreWeave, defense sector, GE Aerospace: Trending Tickers
summary: Catalysts host Madison Mills and Trader Talk podcast host Kenny Polcari take a closer look at some of today's trending tickers. Wall Street analysts initiate coverage of CoreWeave (CRWV) with Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, Jefferies, and Barclays offering bullish calls about the cloud computing company that went public in March. Defense stocks like Northrop Grumman (NOC), RTX (RTX), and Lockheed Martin (LMT) are under pressure as policy uncertainty fuels concerns about the sector. GE Aerospace (GE) earnings beat estimates, with the company saying it is working to offset tariff impacts. headline: Defense Stocks Tumble After RTX Warns of Tariff Hit
summary: Defense contractors were among the biggest losers in the S&P 500 Tuesday after several of the industry's biggest names reported results, with RTX sounding a warning on tariffs. The aerospace and defense specialist said it expects to take an $850 million hit to operating profit from tariffs this year, without factoring in the higher "reciprocal" tariffs that the Trump administration has put on pause.

raw.headline: Defense Stocks Tumble After RTX Warns of Tariff Hit
raw.summary: Defense contractors were among the biggest losers in the S&P 500 Tuesday after several of the industry's biggest names reported results, with RTX sounding a warning on tariffs. headline: Northrop Grumman's profit halves on B-21 losses, shares slump
summary: The company, however, reaffirmed its sales forecast for the year, even amid growing concerns of uncertainty in the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.  U.S. defense contractors, like other industries with complex manufacturing operations, are bracing for impacts from Trump's trade war, which has pressured an already strained supply chain.  The European Union has outlined plans to shore up its own defense capabilities to reduce reliance on the U.S. by 2030,  meaning any role for companies outside the bloc would be substantially limited.

The European Union has outlined plans to shore up its own defense capabilities to reduce reliance on the U.S. by 2030,  meaning any role for companies outside the bloc would be substantially limited.

headline: Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) Misses Q1 Sales Targets, Stock Drops
summary: Security and aerospace company Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 6.6% year on year to $9.47 billion. On the other hand, the company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $42.25 billion at the midpoint. Its GAAP profit of $3.32 per share was 46.7% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its GAAP profit of $3.32 per share was 46.7% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
